Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 218,.proposition: This Court has jurisdiction over this matter pursuant to Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 218, Section 19.

Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 186,.proposition: Defendant's failure to provide Plaintiff with a habitable living environment and necessary utilities, specifically hot water, constitutes a breach of the covenant of quiet enjoyment as outlined in Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 186, Section 14.

**Pines v. Persiani**, 885 N.E.2d 426 (M.proposition: The case law in **Pines v. Persiani**, 885 N.E.2d 426 (Mass. App. Ct. 2008), supports the position that the warranty of habitability includes the provision of essential services such as hot water.
